intro: Cacalia discolor, commonly known as the pink evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has slender, branching stems and heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in dry, open habitats. Cacalia discolor is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other plants with similar floral structures and ecological roles.
